attributes.action: stop the goverment deleting petitons on the basis of free speech
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government may not like it but we have to allow people to say what they think and press for petitions that they believe is right for this country. 

i read a petition asking for a statue to be removed that was rejected on the grounds that it was offensive. And although i strongly disagreed with the petition i still felt that it had a right to be there. 

we are meant to have the right to say what we want in Britain and i am concerned that we are turning into a country where the people in power will only let you say what they agree with, otherwise it is banned. 

as Voltaire said, "I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it." 

We need free speech back and please sign if you agree. 

Joseph, 17

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
